title: 'Posh bingo': a history of Booker Prize bust-ups
text:
Julian Barnes, a one-time winner of the Man Booker Prize, once described the selection process as "posh bingo". This year, for the first time ever, the game has two winners. The decision to split the £50,000 prize money between Margaret Atwood's The Testaments and Bernardine Evaristo’s Girl, Woman, Other was reportedly arrived at after a sit-in and a flagrant bending of the rules by this year's judges.

But such unrest is nothing new.
